Two paired panels of 15th-century Norwich glass painting (St Peter Mancroft, East Window) showing the Visitation and Adoration of the Shepherds.

In the Visitation scene Elizabeth - her pregnant figure indicated by the loosened ties of her gown - hails the Virgin Mary to the left. To the right, a woman stands behind Elizabeth, holding the piece of scarlet cloth that Elizabeth was working on and threw down when she heard of Mary's arrival (a detail from the Apocryphal Book of James: Elliot and James 1924, 43). Behind, between Mary and Elizabeth, stands a prominent tree with cones, upon which perches a large bird. This may be the artist's attempt to represent a cedar (see Psalms 104:16-17
